results.title: Saturday night fever
results.creator_credit: John Badham, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: John Travolta and Karen Gorney star in the film that brought the “seventies generation” out of their homes and into the disco wearing gaberdine pants and platform shoes. After a week of work in a hardware store, Tony transforms himself into the local Disco King. His new dance partner Stephanie, and ex-priest brother, has Tony questioning the shallowness of his life. It is a fine piece of cinema, being not simply a disco dance, but a striking social commentary. The film is memorable for its great soundtrack; the original music being performed and written by the Bee Gees, for the excellence of the dancing and a fantastic performance from Travolta. A must for those who want to re-live a bygone era and connoisseurs of fashion.

results.title: Saturday night again
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Richard Davis and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at situations that could result in drink-driving, and also looks at the other options available through following the social life of a young Sydney group of friends made up of four males and one female in their late teens to early twenties. Covers willingness to intervene in a drink-driving situation; ability to say “no” to someone who wants to drive when he or she is unfit to do so; and alternative ways of spending an evening socialising without the risk of drink-driving. Features Gia Carrides. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Saturday afternoon
results.creator_credit: John A Stewart, Franciscan Communications Center and Teleketics
results.brief_description: Through pantomime, a young couple depict what happens when husband an wife develop roles that block real communication and personal growth.

results.title: Saturday
results.creator_credit: Dean Semler, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Describes a day in the lives of Coral and John Whelan and family, who live at Lake Cargelligo, a small country town in outback New South Wales.

results.title: Satori in the right cortex
results.creator_credit: Kalle Lasn, Don Hopkins, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Satori is a sudden flash of intuitive enlightment—the spiritual goal of Zen Buddhism. This documentary yields insight into the Japanese way of being. Oblique and impressionistic in style, short scenes reflect Japan’s striking contrasts and contradictions. Narration is minimal. Filmed are: monks within a Zen Buddhist monastery; Shintoist and Buddhist street festivals; masked rituals; the Zen-based Kanrisha School of Business Management; and a Shinto initiation ceremony conducted within factory walls. A film for those interested in Far Eastern Studies and religion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kalle Lasn, Don Hopkins, John Taylor and ONF | NFB

results.title: Satellites of the sun
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The science of film animation and new knowledge of outer space brings to the screen this spectacular, awe-inspiring view of our solar system. Staggering distances are eliminated through the art of film, and there, before our eyes, is displayed the wonder of the universe. The moon, Mercury, Mars, Saturn, Venus, Earth, the most favoured planet, and all the other satellites and lesser matter in space are seen in amazing detail and perspective, in their eternal orbits around the sun.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB

results.title: Satchmo
results.creator_credit: Kendrick Simmons, Gary Giddins, Toby Byron and Multiprises
results.brief_description: Louis Armstrong embodied 20th century American culture. No other performer of his era had such a profound effect as a singer as well as an instrumentalist. We hear over a dozen of his classic performances from 1932 to the late sixties, including numerous live concerts, television appearances and home videos.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kendrick Simmons, Gary Giddins, Toby Byron and Multiprises

results.title: Satan's choice
results.creator_credit: Donald Shebib, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A rare “inside” view of a motorcycle club in Toronto, one of the network of such fraternal groups in the large centres across North America. The names they adopt (Satan’s Choice is only one) are as individual as their special ethics and views of life, all freely expressed in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Shebib, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Saskatchewan 45 Below
results.creator_credit: Larry Kent, Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This is a picture of winter on the western prairies, when the full blast of Arctic cold strikes down upon those who live and work there. That life goes on almost without interruption is an example of human resourcefulness and adaptability, but there is no doubt of the peril ever-present in the extreme temperatures. Filmed for the most part in rural Saskatchewan, the film captures the real feel of winter—for farm people, for motorists on (or off) the road, and for animals exposed to it.
